identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of Mirikizumab (LY3074828) in Participants With Moderately to Severely Active Ulcerative Colitis
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Multicenter, Phase 3b, Open-Label, Single-Arm Study to Investigate Bowel Urgency and Its Relationship With Other Outcome Measures in Adults With Moderately to Severely Active Ulcerative Colitis Treated With Mirikizumab

descriptionModule.briefSummary: A study to investigate bowel urgency in adults with moderately to severely active ulcerative colitis (UC) treated with mirikizumab. The study will have 4 periods and will last for 36 weeks.

armGroups.label: Mirikizumab
armGroups.description: Participants will receive mirikizumab intravenously (IV) and mirikizumab subcutaneously (SC).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Bowel Urgency Severity Urgency Numeric Rating Score (UNRS)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Bowel Urgency Frequency
Percentage of Participants Achieving Clinically Meaningful Improvement in Bowel Urgency Frequency
Change from Baseline in Stool Deferral Time
Percentage of Participants Achieving Clinically Meaningful Improvement of Stool Deferral Time
Percentage of Participants achieving Both Clinical Remission, Based on the modified Mayo Score and a UNRS score of ≤1
Percentage of Participants achieving Both Clinical Response, Based on the modified Mayo Score and a UNRS score ≥3 Points of Improvement from Baseline
Pairwise Correlations between the UNRS, Bowel Urgency Frequency, Stool Deferral Time, and Absorbent Product Use Measures
Pairwise Correlations between Change in UNRS, Bowel Urgency Frequency, Stool Deferral Time, and Absorbent Product Use Measures

Correlation between the UNRS, Bowel Urgency Frequency, Stool Deferral Time, and Absorbent Product Use Measures, with Quality of Life (QoL)/Functional Outcome Measures and Ulcerative Colitis (UC) Symptom Measures
Correlation between Change in UNRS, Bowel Urgency Frequency, Stool Deferral Time, and Absorbent Product Use Measures, with Change in QoL/Functional Outcome Measures and UC Symptom Measures

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Have an established diagnosis of UC for ≥3 months
* Have confirmed diagnosis of moderately for severely active UC
* Have current bowel urgency
* Have demonstrated an inadequate response to, a loss of response to, or an intolerance to conventional or to biologic/Janus Kinase (JAK) inhibitor/sphingosine-1-phosphate (S1P) receptor modulator therapy for UC.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Have Crohn's disease (CD)
* Have inflammatory bowel disease-unclassified, formerly known as indeterminate colitis, or
* Have ulcerative proctitis, disease limited to the rectum, that is, distal to the recto-sigmoid junction, which lies approximately 10 to 15 centimeter (cm) from anal verge.
* Have an inherited immunodeficiency syndrome or a monogenic cause of UC-like colonic inflammation
* Have any history or current evidence of cancer of the gastrointestinal tract
* Have active tuberculosis
* Have HIV infection.

seeAlsoLinks.label: A Study of Mirikizumab (LY3074828) in Participants With Moderately to Severely Active Ulcerative Colitis (LUCENT-URGE)

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame:
Time Frame:

Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and European Union (EU), whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
